response.original_title: Stand UP, Speak OUT: Voting Rights - The Soohoo Louie Women
response.overview: A Chinese-American woman grew up in a community where immigration and citizenship were restricted by law. Those who could vote were too afraid of the government to register. Only the election of the first Asian-American to Congress gave them the confidence to exercise their right to vote.
response.tagline: A Chinese-American woman grew up in a community that could not or would not vote.
response.title: Stand UP, Speak OUT: Voting Rights - The Soohoo Louie Women
